description:
go.tools/ssa: memoize synthesis of all wrapper methods.

methodIndex() utility was split and specialized to its two
cases, *Interface vs *Named, which are logically quite
different.

We can't memoize promotion wrappers yet; we need typemap.

Terminology:
- "thunks" are now "wrappers"
- "bridge methods" are now "promotion wrappers"

Where the diff is messy it's just because of indentation.

messages.text:
Hello gri@golang.org (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go.tools

*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=e53dfed08b14&repo=tools ***

go.tools/ssa: memoize synthesis of all wrapper methods.

methodIndex() utility was split and specialized to its two
cases, *Interface vs *Named, which are logically quite
different.

We can't memoize promotion wrappers yet; we need typemap.

Terminology:
- "thunks" are now "wrappers"
- "bridge methods" are now "promotion wrappers"

Where the diff is messy it's just because of indentation.

R=gri
CC=golang-dev
https://codereview.appspot.com/10282043

subject: code review 10282043: go.tools/ssa: memoize synthesis of all wrapper methods.
